perturbation.original_text: Each of Photronics and DNP is hereinafter referred to as a "Shareholder" and collectively as the "Shareholders", each of the Shareholders and PDMC is hereinafter referred to as a "Supplier" and collectively as the "Suppliers", and each of the Suppliers and the Company is hereinafter referred to as a "Party" and collectively as the "Parties."
perturbation.changed_text: Each of Photronics and DNP is hereinafter referred to as a "Shareholder" and collectively as the "Shareholders", each of the Shareholders and PDMC is hereinafter referred to as a "Vendor" and collectively as the "Vendors", and each of the Vendors and the Company is hereinafter referred to as a "Party" and collectively as the "Parties."
perturbation.explanation: The terms 'Supplier' and 'Vendor' are used interchangeably in different sections of the agreement. This creates confusion as to which entity is being referred to in each specific clause, leading to potential disputes over obligations and responsibilities. It becomes unclear whether the Shareholders and PDMC are 'Suppliers' or 'Vendors'.

perturbation.original_text: 2.2 Purchase Orders   The Suppliers will make good faith efforts to accept all [***]from the Company that comply with this Agreement including adhering to all relevant specifications of the Product as set forth in the [***]entered into between the Company and the Supplier (including the [***] (as defined below)). The Suppliers shall notify the Company of acceptance or rejection of a [***]within [***]hours of receipt of a [***]. Failure of the Suppliers to accept or reject a [***]within [***]hours shall constitute acceptance of such [***].
perturbation.changed_text: 2.2 Purchase Orders   The Vendors will make good faith efforts to accept all [***]from the Company that comply with this Agreement including adhering to all relevant specifications of the Product as set forth in the [***]entered into between the Company and the Vendor (including the [***] (as defined below)). The Vendors shall notify the Company of acceptance or rejection of a [***]within [***]hours of receipt of a [***]. Failure of the Distributors to accept or reject a [***]within [***]hours shall constitute acceptance of such [***].
perturbation.explanation: The terms 'Supplier', 'Vendor', and 'Distributor' are used interchangeably. This creates confusion about the identity of the party required to accept or reject purchase orders, and whether a vendor is also a distributor, leading to uncertainty in enforcement of purchase order obligations.

perturbation.original_text: 8.1 Indemnification by the Suppliers   Each of the Suppliers shall, with respect to Products supplied by such Supplier, defend, indemnify and hold harmless the Company from and against any third party claims, expenses and costs (including but not limited to attorney and other professional fees and expenses), settlement (if negotiated and approved by the relevant Supplier), damages and liability to the extent arising from a claim (a) alleging that a Product infringes or misappropriates any Intellectual Property Rights, or (b) arising under products liability theory from a manufacturing defect, and shall pay any judgments finally awarded by a court or any amounts contained in a settlement agreed to by the relevant Supplier arising from such claims.
perturbation.changed_text: 8.1 Indemnification by the Vendors   Each of the Distributors shall, with respect to Products supplied by such Vendor, defend, indemnify and hold harmless the Company from and against any third party claims, expenses and costs (including but not limited to attorney and other professional fees and expenses), settlement (if negotiated and approved by the relevant Vendor), damages and liability to the extent arising from a claim (a) alleging that a Product infringes or misappropriates any Intellectual Property Rights, or (b) arising under products liability theory from a manufacturing defect, and shall pay any judgments finally awarded by a court or any amounts contained in a settlement agreed to by the relevant Vendor arising from such claims.
perturbation.explanation: The terms 'Supplier', 'Vendor', and 'Distributor' are used interchangeably, again. The 'Suppliers' are now called 'Vendors' and 'Distributors'. This creates significant confusion regarding who is responsible for indemnification, particularly in the context of product liability. Is it the original 'Supplier', the 'Vendor', or the 'Distributor'?
